sen.j: 脇能（わきのう）とは、能における神をシテとする曲。
sen.e: Waki Noh is one of the programs of Noh theatrical performance, when Shite (doers) performs with the roles of gods.
Waki Noh is one of the programs of Noh theatrical performance, when the shite (the main actor of a Noh play) performs the roles of gods.
sen.cmt: 他の記事と表現を統一しました。
sen.e: Waki Noh is one of the programs of Noh theatrical performance, when the shite (the main actor of a Noh play) performs the roles of gods.

sen.j: 正式には翁の次に演じられる。
sen.e: This program is the first performance played after a Japanese traditional formal prayer and dance, "Okina," which is performed before proceeding to the Noh program.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: This program is officially the first performance played after a Japanese traditional formal prayer and dance, "Okina."
sen.cmt: 正式には を追加しました。後半の文章が後列と重なることから、一部削除しました。
sen.e: This program is officially the first performance played after a Japanese traditional formal prayer and dance, "Okina."

sen.j: 翁の脇と言う意味から脇能または脇能物と言う。
sen.e: The Okina performance is often proceeded to a Noh program, and the first performance of this Noh program played next to the Okina is called Waki Noh or Waki Noh-mono. (waki means "right near" or "side," or "different direction")
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処。極度に要約されており直訳ではまず意味が通じないでしょう。ここでは脇の意味を「すぐ近く」として訳しましたが、別の意味を持っている可能性もあると思います。曖昧な可能性を残すため「脇」の意味を数種類加えました。
sen.e: The Okina performance is often proceeded to a Noh program, and the first performance of this Noh program played next to the Okina is called Waki Noh or Waki Noh-mono (Waki means "right near" or "side," or "different direction").
sen.cmt: ピリオドの位置を修正しました。
sen.e: The Okina performance is often proceeded to a Noh program, and the first performance of this Noh program played next to the Okina is called Waki Noh or Waki Noh-mono (Waki means "right near" or "side," or "different direction").

sen.j: 能上演形式においては初めに演じられることから初番目物や一番目物と言われる。
sen.e: It is also called "Shobanme mono" or "Ichibanme mono" (both means "the first performance") since this is the first performance of a formal Noh program.
Since this is the first performance, it is called shobanme-mono or ichibanme-mono (first-category plays) according to the style of Noh performance.
sen.cmt: 他の記事と表現を統一しました。
sen.e: Since this is the first performance, it is called shobanme-mono or ichibanme-mono (first-category plays) according to the style of Noh performance.

sen.j: 多くは天下の太平を寿ぐ、目出度い内容である。
sen.e: Many of the Waki Noh performance describes about an auspicious story and praying for the peace of the world and the well-being of people.
It is often an auspicious story that prays for the peace of the world and the well-being of people.
sen.cmt: 文法を一部修正しました。
sen.e: It is often an auspicious story that prays for the peace of the world and the well-being of people.

sen.j: 使用する扇は神扇（かみおうぎ）と言われ、白骨に妻紅。
sen.e: The traditional Japanese folding fan used for this performance is called "Kami Ohgi," (fan of a sacred god) built with "Shirahone" bones of a fan (a white colored bones of a fan, which is for the Ohgi for the role of a god or an old man, without putting a Noh mask on) and its face of a fan decorated with "Tsuma-beni." (Tuma-beni is a red cloud pattern, used for the Ohgi for the role of a young and flamboyant characters)
sen.cmt: 簡単に調べたところでも能においては全てが何らかの意味を持つようです。説明なしでの直訳ではまったく意味が通じないと思いましたので、多少意味を加えたものも例として訳してみましたが。。。まずければ赤字部分を削除ください。
sen.e: The traditional Japanese folding fan used for this performance is called Kami ogi (fan of a sacred god) built with shirobone bones (white colored bones of a fan, which is used for the role of a god or an old man, without putting a Noh mask on) and its face decorated with tsuma-beni (red cloud pattern, used for the role of a young and flamboyant characters).
sen.cmt: 文法を一部修正しました。
sen.e: The traditional Japanese folding fan used for this performance is called Kami ogi (fan of a sacred god) built with shirobone bones (white colored bones of a fan, which is used for the role of a god or an old man, without putting a Noh mask on) and its face decorated with tsuma-beni (red cloud pattern, used for the role of a young and flamboyant characters).
Popular Waki Noh performances
Popular Waki Noh performances
Popular Waki Noh performances

sen.j: 『高砂 (能)』『老松』『大社』『岩船』『右近』『絵馬』『賀茂（加茂）』『呉羽』『志賀』『西王母 (能)』『玉井』『竹生島』『鶴亀』『難波』『白楽天』『氷室』『放生川』『和布刈』『養老』
sen.e: "Takasago" "Oimatsu" "Ohyashiro" "Iwafune" "Ukon" "Ema" "Kamo" "Kureha" "Shiga" "Saiohbo" "Tamanoi" "Chikubushima" "Tsurukame" "Naniwa" "Hakurakuten" "Himuro" "Hojogawa" "Mekari" "Yohro"

"Takasago (Noh)", "Oimatsu" (The Old Pine Tree), "Oyashiro" (Grand Shrine), "Iwafune" (A Rock Boat), "Ukon," "Ema" (The Votive Tablet), "Kamo," "Kureha," "Shiga," "Saiobo (Noh)" (The Queen Mother of the West), "Tamanoi" (Jewel Well), "Chikubushima" (Chikubu-shima Island), "Tsurukame" (Crane and Tortoise), "Naniwa," "Hakurakuten" (Bai Letian), "Himuro" (The Ice House), "Hojogawa" (Hojo-gawa River), "Mekari" (Harvesting Seagrass), "Yoro" (Nurturing the Aged)
sen.cmt: 演目名及び英訳を表記しました （定訳不明です）。
sen.e: "Takasago (Noh)", "Oimatsu" (The Old Pine Tree), "Oyashiro" (Grand Shrine), "Iwafune" (A Rock Boat), "Ukon," "Ema" (The Votive Tablet), "Kamo," "Kureha," "Shiga," "Saiobo (Noh)" (The Queen Mother of the West), "Tamanoi" (Jewel Well), "Chikubushima" (Chikubu-shima Island), "Tsurukame" (Crane and Tortoise), "Naniwa," "Hakurakuten" (Bai Letian), "Himuro" (The Ice House), "Hojogawa" (Hojo-gawa River), "Mekari" (Harvesting Seagrass), "Yoro" (Nurturing the Aged)
